qas.question: What type of religious practices outnumbered the state observances?
To what did the mixture of official and individual religious practices  pertain?
What were the characteristics of state religious observances?
Who made the choices of personal religious practices in Rome?
What type of deities did Roman communities have?

context: The <a2_0>impressive, costly, and centralised<a2_0/> rites to the deities of the Roman state were vastly outnumbered in everyday life by <a0_0>commonplace<a0_0/> religious observances pertaining to an <a3_0>individual<a3_0/>'s domestic and personal deities, the <a4_0>patron<a4_0/> divinities of Rome's various neighborhoods and communities, and the often idiosyncratic blends of official, unofficial, local and personal cults that characterised <a1_0>lawful Roman<a1_0/> religion. In this spirit, a provincial Roman citizen who made the long journey from Bordeaux to Italy to consult the Sibyl at Tibur did not neglect his devotion to his own goddess from home:
